name: Bhootnath Temple
history: Bhootnath Temple is one of the oldest and most famous temples in Mandi, Himachal Pradesh.It was built in 1527 by Raja Ajbar Sen, the founder of Mandi city. The temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva, who is worshipped here in the form of Bhootnath (Lord of spirits).The temple is built in traditional Shikhara-style architecture with beautiful stone carvings and ancient designs. It is located in the heart of Mandi town and is considered the spiritual center of the city.The temple becomes the main attraction during the International Shivratri Festival, when hundreds of deities from nearby villages are brought in colorful processions to pay respect to Lord Shiva.For locals, Bhootnath Temple is not just a place of worship but also a symbol of Mandiâ€™s history, culture, and devotion.

name: Mata Hidimba Devi Temple
history: Ancient cave temple dedicated to Hidimba Devi in Manali.

name: Bada Dev - Kamrunag Temple
history: The Kamrunag Temple, located near Mandi in Himachal Pradesh, is an ancient shrine dedicated to King Yaksha (or Barbarik), a revered Mahabharata-era warrior believed to be the son of Ghatotkacha and grandson of Bhima.

name: Prashar Lake Temple
history: Legend suggests the lake was created when Rishi Prashar struck his rod into the ground.
